text.0: A 52-year-old woman presented with painless, bilateral parotid swelling. Imaging showed dilatation of the parotid (Stensen’s) ducts, and palpation resulted in profuse bilateral salivary discharge. A video shows saliva firing from the parotid ducts.
text.1: The NEJM Race and Medicine topic page features a selection of NEJM articles on race and medicine with implications for improving patient care, professional training, research, and public health. All articles assembled on the page are freely available.
text.2: Sensory ganglionopathy is characterized by sensory loss without weakness. A common pathophysiological mechanism is autoimmunity. This review focuses on acquired sensory ganglionopathies, most commonly seen in patients with an autoimmune disease or a paraneoplastic disorder.
text.3: Even short, frequent exposures to people who have #COVID19 could lead to transmission, new CDC data suggest.
text.4: Join clinical experts, thought leaders, and advocates for a collaborative discussion on the issues of health disparities, structural racism, and medicine as we examine specific dermatologic diseases. Register for 1 or all 4! @SkinofColor @VisualDx #skinofcolor #dermtwitter
text.5: AK002, an anti–Siglec-8 antibody, reduced eosinophils and symptoms of gastritis and duodenitis with frequencies of adverse events similar to placebo, although infusion-related reactions were more common with AK002.
text.6: A chemo-free induction and consolidation first-line treatment of Ph-positive ALL with dasatinib and blinatumomab based on a targeted and immunotherapeutic strategy was associated with high incidences of molecular response and survival.
